vaccine0To6Mnth.sideEffect:
1) soreness or discharge where the injection was given.
 2) high temperature (fever) 
 3) headache. 
 4) swollen glands under the armpit in the arm where the injection was given.

Aches or pain in the joints, fever, or skin rash or welts (may occur days or weeks after receiving the vaccine) 
 blurred vision or other vision changes. 
 difficulty with breathing or swallowing. 
 itching, especially of the feet or hands. 
 muscle weakness. 
 numbness or tingling of the arms and legs.
fever, irritability, malaise, and non-specific symptoms, such as diarrhea, headache, and/or muscle pain.
fever, irritability, malaise, and non-specific symptoms, such as diarrhea, headache, and/or muscle pain.

vaccine0To6Mnth.PreventAgnst: Diphtheria, Pertussis, Tetanus, Hepatitis B and Hib
vaccine0To6Mnth.sideEffect: tenderness and/or swelling at the injection site. raised temperature (fever) irritability. sickness. diarrhoea. loss of appetite.
Irritability or mild, temporary diarrhea or vomiting
fever and soreness or redness at the site of the injection
fever, irritability, malaise, and non-specific symptoms, such as diarrhea, headache, and/or muscle pain.

vaccine6To12Mnth.sideEffect: mild pain and redness at the injection site, low-grade fever, rash and muscle aches
Pain, tenderness, redness, or swelling where the shot was given are common after JE vaccine.

vaccine1YearTo5Years.sideEffect: Soreness or swelling where the shot was given, fever, fussiness, feeling tired, loss of appetite, and vomiting sometimes happen after DTaP vaccination.
More serious reactions, such as seizures, non-stop crying for 3 hours or more, or high fever (over 105°F) after DTaP vaccination happen much less often.
fever, irritability, malaise, and non-specific symptoms, such as diarrhea, headache, and/or muscle pain.
fever, irritability, malaise, and non-specific symptoms, such as diarrhea, headache, and/or muscle pain.

vaccine6YearsPlus.sideEffect: Soreness or swelling where the shot was given, fever, fussiness, feeling tired, loss of appetite, and vomiting sometimes happen after DTaP vaccination.

Confusion. convulsions (seizures) fever over 103 °F (39.4 °C) headache (severe or continuing) sleepiness (excessive) swelling, blistering, or pain at place of injection (severe or continuing) swelling of glands in armpit. unusual irritability.
